articles.author: Andrew Mills, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Disagreements over Israel's future military presence in Gaza and over Palestinian prisoner releases are obstructing a ceasefire and hostage deal, according to ten sources familiar with the round of U.S.-mediated talks that concluded last week.
articles.title: Exclusive: Israeli demands for troops in Gaza blocking truce deal, sources say

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: The daughter of a Jamaican father and Indian mother, both immigrants, Kamala Harris reflects the United States' changing demographics.
articles.title: In Kamala Harris' multiracial roots, U.S. sees its own future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Thursday its troops had beaten back an attempt by a Ukrainian force to infiltrate its border in a different region to Kyiv's incursion onto Russian territory, while Ukrainian drones struck near an air base in southern Russia.
articles.title: Russia says it thwarts Ukrainian cross-border raid in new area

articles.author: Giselda Vagnoni, Guglielmo Mangiapane
articles.description: The body of British tech magnate Mike Lynch was retrieved on Thursday from the wreck of his family yacht that sank earlier this week off the coast of Sicily during a violent storm, a senior Italian official said.
articles.title: Body of British tech entrepreneur Lynch retrieved from yacht, daughter missing

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed deeper into areas of the central and southern Gaza Strip as they battled Hamas fighters, while Palestinian health officials said on Thursday that Israeli strikes had killed at least 22 people across the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli tanks push deeper into Gaza, as Biden urges peace

articles.author: Kate Lamb, Ananda Teresia
articles.description: Indonesia's parliament postponed ratifying changes to an elections law on Thursday amid protests in multiple cities, following outcry over legislation seen to strengthen the political influence of outgoing President Joko Widodo.
articles.title: Protests across Indonesia as parliament delays change to election law

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in St Petersburg have detained an Israeli-Canadian racing car driver wanted by the United States for alleged large-scale fraud relating to an illegal online stock trading scheme, the city's court system said on Wednesday evening.
articles.title: Russia detains Israeli-Canadian citizen wanted in US for fraud

articles.author: Allison Lampert, Abhinav Parmar, Jahnavi Nidumolu
articles.description: The Canadian government will announce soon how it plans to tackle a nationwide freight rail stoppage, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Thursday, stressing the need for a quick solution.
articles.title: Canada rail shutdown: PM says action coming soon

articles.author: Ivan Lyubysh-Kirdey
articles.description: Mariia Moiseieva watched from her bed as a relative packed her belongings into plastic bags for the bedbound 94-year-old to be evacuated from the east Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk on Thursday.
articles.title: Frail and elderly flee east Ukrainian city as Russians advance

articles.author: Octav Ganea
articles.description: A Romanian court has ordered internet personality Andrew Tate to be placed under house arrest, his representative said on Thursday, after he was among six people taken into custody in an investigation into human trafficking and sexual exploitation.
articles.title: Internet personality Andrew Tate ordered to be put under house arrest
